Name: Of Aliens and Giants
Description:
Of Aliens and Giants

An Expansion for the hex based wargame  based on fleet level space combat set in the babylon 5 universe published by Agents of gaming and now out of print.

FA-1013 OF ALIENS AND GIANTS focuses on the Shadows and Vorlons, including background material and all the rules needed to play these First Ones in your Fleet Action games! Also included are three of the League races - the Brakiri Syndicracy, Drazi Freehold, and Vree Guilds! 124 pages of Fleet Action fun!

.from the AOG website.

Name: To The Victor
Description:
To the Victor...

FA-1012 TO THE VICTOR...: The second Fleet Action supplement spotlights the ongoing feud between the Narn and Centauri, including the spectacular War of Retribution fought between the two races at the end of 2259. All the ships used in the war are spotlighted, such as the massive Octurion Battleship and Bin'Tak Dreadnought, as well as specialty units like the G'Karith, Dag'Kar, Dargan, and Maximus. Also includes background information on the war and extensive historical data on the Narn and Centauri races, plus rules for minefields, special officers, hexless movement, and semi-plotted movement!

from aog website

Name: My Enemy, My Ally
Description:
from AOG website
My Enemy, My Ally

FA-1011 MY ENEMY...MY ALLY: The first supplement for Fleet Action focuses on the Earth Alliance and Minbari Federation, from their disastrous first encounter to the Earth Civil War and their eventual alliance. Included are all the ships from the Atlas of Earth Alliance Wars supplement of Babylon 5 Wars (such as the Artemis, Tethys, Avenger, and Poseidon on the Earth side, and the Neshatan, Torotha, Tigara, and Morshin for the Minbari), plus a few new ships never seen before - including the powerful Warlock Advanced Cruiser!

Name: Ratz-Fatz in die Schule
Description:
The box offers many pretty wooden pieces for the theme of this 4th Ratz-Fatz game, a teacher, a bus, a school bag, a book, a clock, animals like giraffe or seal, a bun, a lolly, a ball etc. The pieces are used for play, especially in play with talking, story-telling and asking questions to train recognition, concentration, ability to talk and reaction.

The games offered are:
-Ordne zu – an allocation game, 
-Greif zu – a reaction game, 
-Schau hin – a search game.

11 texts for reading aloud are included in the rules, poems, storys, riddles, but any text can be adapted for use with this game.

Name: Schlaubär: Wer kennt die Berufe?
Description: The children should try to find the halves with the same professions and name the professions correctly. The cards are turned face down, shuffled and laid out. The active player turns up two cards, if the pair matches, the child is asked to describe the profession. The “Schlaubär” allows control, if he fits into the cut-outs of the pair, the pair matches. If so the child receives both cards. The game can also be played with open cards and the child simply should find matching cards.

Name: Stix & Stones
Description:
The prehistoric picture-making race!

A prehistoric picture–making race! Create like a caveman using only sticks and stones—no drawing skills required! Dare each other to make a picture with as few pieces as possible, then challenge the other players to guess what it is. Remember, the clock is always ticking!

Builds fine motor, creative and social skills through game play that's perfect for mixed age groups

Features 75 game cards providing 450 words of varying difficulty, ensuring a different game every time and an engaging experience for players of all ages

Includes 40 plastic sticks (twenty 4"L, twenty 2"L), 15 plastic stones (1" in diameter), arrow (1.25L"), die, 60 second sand timer, and burlap bag to store the game pieces and instructions.

Name: Insecto
Description:
INSECTO is like first board games for children.  It is the great insect race with this 2-sided magnetized board game with plush insects and useful carrying case.  It initiates youngsters to board games and develops concentration and dexterity.
Insecto is an ideal travel game with 2 interesting ways to play:

BUZZY BUZZY BEEZ

Bees go from flower to flower all day long in search of the precious nectar.  At the end of the day, it is a race to return to the nest.  Which bee will be the first to enter the nest?

Each player advances his bee the number of flowers indicated by the number on the die.  Every time a bee stops on a flower where the tail end of a caterpillar is found, this bee must slide down to the flower where the head of the caterpillar is found. Every time a bee stops on a flower where a butterfly is found, this bee must follow the butterflies to the other flower.  But take care to the spider webs or your bee will skip a turn!  The first bee to enter the nest wins the game.

VEGGIE LAND

Ladybugs are very useful in a vegetable garden as they feed on harmful insects.  VEGGIE LAND is a simple game that is captivating, yet easy to play for kids 3 years of age and up.  It does not require any reading or counting skills.

On his turn, each player rolls the die and moves forward to the next vegetable illustrated on the die.  On certain vegetables, there is a spider!  If a player stops on a vegetable with a spider, he must skip a turn.  But if a player stops on a vegetable with a ladybug, he plays again!  Then, a few vegetables come in pair.  If a player stops on pair of vegetables, he moves forward to the next single similar vegetable.  The first ladybug (player) to reach the vegetable cart wins the game.

Name: Mean Streets
Description: Set in the 1920's in Chicago, players in this game purchase businesses at auction, placing them into a map of the city to try and get the highest property values possible. They also bribe, blackmail and purchase their way onto five organizations in the city, including the Mafia, the Bureau, and the City Newspaper, which allow them different actions they can take to boost their own properties and sabotage others. They can even become the Mayor, or the Don!

Name: Zahour
Description:
Game of words. You battle for connecting opposite sides of 5x5 square. On each turn you pick one place with a theme on it (city, name, flower, etc.). You roll a 20sided dice.and according to the letter you have to come as first with at least three words for that theme starting with the letter.
It can be played in variants with time, difficulty can be adjusted by number of words. Children can play.
Also board for couples is included.

Name: The Curse of the Pharaoh
Description:
Plays on 3D board depicting a pyramid.
It is a Disney game, in which players took Minnie, Goofy, etc. and are trying to reach top of the pyramid. They have to complete tasks and answer tricky questions.
They move according to a dice throw around the pyramid on three levels, only on one place they can move up, but always can fall back down. On other places they have to take a card with task or question or get a torch, which can save your life before you fall down through the hidden door.
It is a children's game.
Pictures on the pyramid are very detailed with disneys attention to detail.

Name: Barbie: World of Models
Description:
Girls game of how to become a model.
It features a 3D game board with a catwalk. Every Barbie/player has a set of cards, which she has to play in order to win. The players take turns and draw one card from the opponent and one from hers pile.

Name: Name That Word! Vocabulary Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Children build language skills, improve vocabulary and more…as they give clues and try to guess mystery words! In this fun-filled board game, kids play with partners or teams, drawing photo-word cards in 8 categories including actions, emotions and everyday objects. Players then describe or act out the word to their teammates…and try to guess the most words by the end of the game!"

Game components:
Game board
140 photo game cards
6 game pawns
1 six sided die

Name: All Around Town Sorting Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Children develop sorting, classifying and thinking skills as they travel around a fun-filled town—from the supermarket to the bookstore! In this lively board game, players move from one store to the next, collecting items such as clothing, books and art supplies. They sort the items onto storefronts on their game mats…and race to become the first player to collect an item from every store!"

Game components:
Game board
4 activity mats
30 item cards
30 number cards
4 game pawns

Name: Battle of the Planets
Description:
Take control of a fleet of ships and move across the obstacle filled battle field in attempt to beat your opponent to the goal. This fast paced game is based on the "Battle of the Planets" animated series (also called Gatchaman, G-Force and Eagle Riders) and is filled with unique artwork based on the animated series.

The game is subtitled H Omada "G" or The "G" Team.

Name: Fire Station Dalmatian Early Math Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Children build tons of essential math skills…as they race to collect, count, add and subtract spots on friendly Dalmatians! In this lively board game, players move around the board to the fire station, adding or subtracting spots on their Dalmatians as they go. When everyone has reached the station, they count up their spots…and the dog with the most spots gets to be the Fire Station Dalmatian!"

Game components:
Game board
25 game cards
70+ Dalmatian spots
4 Game pawns

Name: Space Station Sight-Word Game
Description:
Publishers description:
"Children practice reading tons of essential sight-words…as they race to explore an alien space station! In this lively game, players take turns flipping over alien cards and spaceship cards on the game board, then reading the words printed on back. If the two words match, players get to keep the cards…and try to collect the most cards by the end of the game!"

Game components:
Game board
90+ color-coded game cards (two levels of play)

Name: Der Zankapfel
Description:
Der Zankapfel is a tile placement game, in which players build trees with hexagonal limb cards.
During the phases spring, summer, and autumn, depending on a dice roll, you can place limbs (straight, bend, broken), apples or special tiles like beehives. The player who harvests the most apples (and gets a bonus form specials like the hive) wins the game.

Name: Manimals: Australien & Neuseeland 1
Description:
Manimals is a beautiful animal game that is also well-suited for learning in the classroom or for use in homes. Through the game, players learn the attributes of animals.
Who knows the animals best?

All animal cards are placed face up on the table. One card is flipped. The backside shows a search criterion like, has finger, can swim or has feathers. Players than simultaneously collect animals they believe to fit this criteria. As soon as nobody wants to pick another animal, the backsides of the cards are examined, to check if the choice was correct. The player with the most correct animals scores two points, the second one scores one.

Includes rules for ages 4 and up, as well.

The focus of this edition is: Animals from Australia and New Zealand.

Name: You May Fire When Ready Gridley! Rules For Pre-Dreadnought Naval Wargames 1880 To 1905
Description:
Fire When Ready covers actions with pre-dreadnoughts. They come with a set of rules for creating your game statistics for your vessels using published sources such as "Jane’s" or "Conway’s".

The rules features an choice of game systems. The "Duel" Game is intended for use with a small number of ships and each ship has a captain and crew generated individually. The "Battle" system is for large battles such as Tsushima and ships operate in formations, each of which has a Commander and ships' crew ratings are generated for a formation.

There are alternative gunnery systems offering simultaneous effects (which can be used with the "Duel" Game) or sequential effects based on initiative, in which shooting follows in order of initiative (highest scores shoot first) and where damage is applied immediately (this can be used in either game system).

The gunnery rules include the effects of "crossing the T" and other features. It is now possible to achieve significant amounts of damage and multiple special hits.

There are 10 scenarios and ready calculated ship data is provided so you can sit down and play any of them.

(Publishers Description)

Name: Zogaj
Description:
This game is played in two phases. In the first phase all players memorize pairs of tiles with different icons (or triplets or even bigger groups for extra complexity). The pairs are then flipped over and mixed. The example in the rulebook is for instance the pair: tea pot + couch 
In the second phase the players take turns flipping two tiles - if one of the pairs were flipped the player keeps it and flips another pair (flip triplets when playing the more difficult variant). The player with most pairs when all tiles are taken wins the game.

beginner variant 10-12 pairs, normal 20 pairs and expert 30 pairs.


From zogaj.se/zogaj-shopen

The Game that teaches you how to use your hidden memory powers while having fun! You will be surprised over how easy it is and how powerful your brain is when used correctly. This game teaches you how to think.

The Game is suitable for all ages. It is perfect as a family-game but also for adults who wants to see how others think. The game is also a powerful learning tool for the person who wants to show grown-ups as well as children how Active Memory techniques works and how one can start to develop a super-memory.

Name: 47 Ronin
Description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #4.

This game covers one of the most important Samurai-era episode "ChÅ«shingura".  ChÅ«shingura happened December 14th, 1702.
One year before the incident, Asano-takumi, the lord of Akou-han was ordered to harakiri by Shogun Tokugawa Tsunayoshi without detailed judgement due to his outrageous action in Edo-castle.
The 47 warriors of Akou-han had strong will to revenge this judgement and had waited for one year to do the final action.
In falling snow, the 47 warriors assaulted their target Kira's house and did their wish without seriouse damege on their side.
But, Shogun Tokugawa Tsunayoshi again decided to order them harakiri.
Because of their strong will and bushido-spirits, this fact became very popular as "ChÅ«shingura".  Even in recent period, this is very popular on TV drama series again and again.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ChÅ«shingura

This game covers this episode by small wargame.
8 page rulebook
80 counters
1 map
2 dice

Name: Cult
Description:
Cult is a card-based strategy game about fanciful religious cults.  You start with a single god with no worshippers, and during the game, you develop a cult of followers for your god and build a temple to your god.  You’ll be in competition with other cults, and you may eventually add other gods and cults to your pantheon.  Your goal in the game is to attract more followers (and stronger followers) to your cult and to build complete temples to your gods.

You'll also be able to take your pesky competitor cults down a notch or two with special cards such as Heresy, Purge, Iconoclasm, and many others.

Sometime during the game, there will be a prophecy.  When the prophecy is fulfilled, it's the End of Days, and whoever is ahead wins!

The game is family friendly and easy to learn.  It takes about 45-60 minutes to play depending on how fast you are.

Name: Face to Face: A Cubist Strategy Game
Description: Face to Face is an abstract cubist strategy game. Players place tiles representing either an eye, nose, or mouth in the right place at the right time in order to win the game. In the process the cubist inspired games pieces create a unique cubist composition.

Name: Perfidious Albion: Naval Wargame Rules For The Pre-Dreadnought Era
Description:
The game system uses a broadside ship plan to record both the ship game details and the damage caused by shooting. Guns, turrets, conning tower, propulsion, steering gear, magazines and quick firers are all shown, and the damage system records hits and resulting damage. Also included are ship’s crew skills, differences in technology, armour penetration and torpedoes, weather, etc. The rules also allow for torpedo resolution and the use of mines.

The Dockyard Manual is part of the rules, enabling the player to design his own ships for the game, either from historical sources or his imagination. Technological variety is allowed for, so that ships can range from early ironclads to modern (for 1910) warships. The booklet also includes some sample ships built using the design system.

The links include downloads for War in the Air, a Campaign system and Victorian Fantasy Scenarios.

Name: Tsushima: Naval Wargame Rules For Pre-Dreadnought Actions 1880 - 1906
Description:
These rules are quick and simple to play providing a very fast and bloody game in the period 1880 to 1906. The scale is 1 nautical mile to 10cm. The rules incorporate weather, spotting, minefields and allow for both written orders or sequential movement.

The gunnery system takes account of the ranges, penetration and damage by specifying the dice that are rolled to attack in a given situation. Torpedo, Mine and Ramming attacks are resolved using similar mechanisms, so there is a consistent feel throughout the combat system.

In line with the style and intention of the rules, armour has been standardised for each class of vessel (of which there are ten covered). Guns have been grouped into 9 classes following the same philosophy.

There is a fleet list covering the significant vessels of 10 nations in this period with 130 vessels. A simple conversion system allows you to quickly put together the game data you need to fight a battle.

Counters are provided to enable you to sit down and play both an introductory scenario and Tsushima-style encounter between Russian and Japanese fleets

(Publishers Description)

Name: Fighting Fleets
Description:
This booklet provides Ship Grids for Perfidious Albion and Combat data for Fire When Ready rules. There are about 200 classes of ship of all sizes provided from Austria-Hungary, China, France, Germany, Great Britain, Greece, Italy, Japan, Russia, Spain, Sweden, Turkey and United States, as well as some generic cargo ships.

For Perfidious Albion the 10 x 6 Ship Grids can be photocopied or transferred to blank ship cards as you wish. All the data you need to play the game is provided including gunnery modifiers and torpedo sizes. The points value for each ship has been calculated for a standard crew.

For Fire When Ready the game data has been calculated for the ships in the booklet and shows the gunnery data including gun type and penetration required for the game. The armour protection for ships has been assessed and is shown for all the locations needed for the game.

Note that this product is intended for use with Fire When Ready, or Perfidious Albion, and a copy of either of these rules is required.

(Publishers Description)

Name: Chick N Derby
Description: Rev up Your engines for Chick N Derby, a colorful new family board game where chickens don crash helmets and get behind the wheel in an attempt to be the first to cross the finish line with all of their five Letters lined up to spell D-E-R-B-Y. - Back of Box

Name: Forge of War
Description:
Forge of War is a free set of tabletop miniature rules for depicting small unit, i.e. squad level, science fiction combat which also includes rules for AFVs and artillery.

Notionally for 28mm scale figures (although it would be equally suitable for other scales such as 15mm) it was originally produced to offer a viable alternative to more complex commercially available rule sets.

With variable unit activation; and with as much emphasis on command, control and morale as there is on the hardware, Forge of War offers a different, yet easily accessible, alternative to more traditional rule sets.

Name: Panorama
Description: This game is a "War-Peace" strategy game.  Each player starts the game with a unique "Sealed Orders" sheet which assigns that player a specific color of units, and a list of 4-6 "Peaceful" objectives or 4-6 "War / Agressor" objectives.  Each player selects a secret objective from their list.  Players then take turns placing their units, trying to capture opponents units or to reach their objective.  When a player reaches their objective the game ends and all players add up their victory points to determine the winner.

Name: Go-Kart Rally Sight-Words Game: Grade 2
Description:
Publisher description:

"A fun way to learn sight-words, build vocabulary, and increase reading fluency.

As students race around the game board, they get hands-on practice using sight-words in context! The game is super-easy to play—students just move around the board, landing on spaces printed with 40 grade-appropriate sight-words. Each time they land on one, students try to use it in a sentence on their game cards. The first one to complete all 8 sentences wins!"

Game components:
Game board
10 write and wipe cards
4 write and wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six-sided die

Name: ASL Annual '91
Description:
The third annual magazine/supplement for ASL, containing articles and scenarios.

From the Table of Contents:
Series Replay: Red Barricades by J. Mitchell, L. Watson, F. Calcagno and C. Kibler
The Forgotten Legions by Charles Markuss
Early Victims, Early Victories by Mark C. Nixon
Market-Garden by Jon Mishcon
The Numbers of October by Mark C. Nixon
The Mouse That Roared by Bob McNamara

Scenarios:
A26 Beachhead at Ozereyka Bay
A27 King's Castle
A28 The Professionals
A29 A Meeting of Patrols
A30 Defeat in Java
A31 On the Road to Andalsnes
A32 Zon With the Wind
A33 Tettau's Attack
A34 Lash Out
A35 Guards Attack
A36 Oy Veghel
A37 Dreil Team
A38 North Bank
DA7 Lehr Sanction
DA8 Gruppo Mobile
HA1 Fire on the Volga

Name: Małe zoo
Description:
Every child loves to visit the zoo. Admire the magnificent animals, exotic specimens, endangered species. Now all these things can happen on the game board. Each player is the owner of the zoo, he must make to the zoo was full of animals.Be careful with the amount of space at the zoo since we have limited. During the game we decide whether it is better to have large animals such as elephant or a giraffe or more animals, but smaller. Pride of every zoo are rare animals (Panda bear, or Chameleon). 
When the zoo will be full of animals, it's time to exchange specimens with other players, and visit our zoo visitors in giving us the victory points. The player who collects the first set of their number to be the winner.

Name: Świat Dinozaurów
Description: In this game, the player operates and develops its flock of ancient reptiles, must ensure access to water holes. Dinosaurs should be deployed on the board so as to form a herd, the young dinosaurs hatch from eggs and adults occupy more land for your cluster. Unfortunately, the ancient earth was filled with threats, most are predatory Tyrannosaurus! Once the board is moving so terrifying reptile hunts for smaller vulnerable individuals, you have to keep meeting with him. Your herd may dissipate after the attack, Tyrannosaurus, and your effort to build the herd will go for naught. Win the game the player who takes the largest number of holes and bring together the largest herd.

Name: Ascend
Description:
Ascend is a Decktet climbing game for 3 to 4 players.

You and your opponents try to be the first duck to reach the peak. During the ascent you will be set back by bombs falling from the sky. Therefore, it takes quite some personality to persist the ascent in order to be able to crown oneself as King of the Quackers and flush the opponents straight back to the swampy pond they came from.

The game is played over multiple hands. Every hand you get dealt some cards. After each hand, you score points according to how quickly you got rid of your cards. Your points accumulate from hand to hand and once someone collects enough points he or she is declared the winner of the game.

Name: Double Knot
Description:
A trick-taking Decktet game for 3 to 5 players with a lot of trumps.

Double Knot is the favourite trick-taking game among pandas. It's a common habit to end a dispute with a game of Double Knot in order to decide who gets to sleep in the best bed. Unfortunately, in case of a tie, play is continued. This explains the amount of pandas.

The game is named after the two highest cards in the game, the Ace of Knots and the Crown of Knots.

In Double Knot every player bids a number of tricks. The object of the game is to win exactly the number of tricks bid and at the same time let other people fail to do the same.

In a hand of Double Knot, each of the Decktet cards is treated as belonging only to the top suit. The bottom suits of the first card played to a trick determines which cards can be used as trumps in that trick.

The rules of the game can be found at the Decktet wiki.

Name: Rusalka
Description: You are a peasant looking for herbs in forests. You meet mythological beings from Slavic mythology like Rusalka and Lešij. This is a small game that was published inside a book about Slavic mythology titled Nebeski Dvori i Zemaljske Vode- Tragovima Slavenske Mitologije (Heavenly Courts and Earthly Waters: Traces of Slavic Mythology). Your goal is to collect the most herbs and to be the first one to tell your village that you saw the Rusalka, fairy, Lešij, etc. You can enchant other players with the help of the mythological beings or steal other players herbs. There is a moment when you have to be first to say "Ir" to defend your self from snake bite!

Name: Honigklau
Description:
a dice game, try to get your bear over the pond jumping from log to log, get the honey and get back without getting your honey stolen by another bear.

Hmmm..., lecker, schlecker! Da läuft unseren Bären ganz schön das Wasser im Mund zusammen. Die Bienen auf der anderen Seite des Sees haben fleißig Honig gesammelt. Jetzt heißt es für die Bären nichts wie hin. Dabei wird von Baumstamm zu Baumstamm gehüpft. Die sind wackelig und das Wegschnappen und Rauswerfen ist auch erlaubt. Dies bringt Spßa - aber Vorsicht - auch neue Verfolger! Wer sich den meisten Honig holt, wird bärenstarker Gewinner. Spielschachtelformat: 37,5 x 27,5 x 3,5 cm

Publisher Blurb

Name: De Boer Sjopspel
Description:
De Boer Sjopspel is a game where players try to obtain all products listed on a shopping list. They do so by rolling a die to move on the board, trying to get to the items they need. The first person to get all the items and return to the cash register is the winner.

The pawns are in the shape of shopping cards, made from plastic.
The items come in the form of thick cardboard pieces which will be randomly placed on the board. Each card has a picture of the product printed on it.

--user summary

Name: Monster Math Add and Subtract
Description: Take part in an island adventure that is both fun and challenging! Determine which basic facts children need to master and then select the cards for one of four skill levels: sums to 10, sums 11 to 18, minuends to 10 and minuends 11 to 18. Players take turns uncovering the board by answering and matching game cards correctly and see the funny antics of delightful monsters.

Name: I Spy Alphabet Aquarium
Description: Learn letters and beginning letter sounds by matching colorful fish cards to the correct letters or images on the aquarium game board. Three ways to play: match uppercase letters to each other, match uppercase letters to lowercase letters, or match letters to pictures of things with that beginning letter sound. Includes large game board, game cards, markers, and directions.

Name: Nanuk: 1st Promo Card
Description:
Official Rules

During the planning phase of a hunt, this card is wild. It counts as whatever animal is being hunted. If it is drawn during the finishing phase of a hunt, it counts as a Nanuk. If it is blocked by an Inuksuk, allowing the hunt to continue, it counts as one animal toward the hunters' total.

When scored, it is wild... it can be used as one animal of any type. It has a Nanuk in the corner, so it also counts toward the "most Nanuks" bonus.

http://www.sjgames.com/nanuk/promo.html

Name: Tank Attack
Description:
"Red Tanks vs Blue Tanks, this game puts you in command of a Tank Division. You must use your supplies carefully and maneuver your Tanks with skill or face defeat.  The battlefield is simple, the Tanks are ready. Are you ready?" From the Rulebook

Tank Attack is  game for 2 players in a squared board. It uses a combination of piece movement, dice throwing and card playing. The two players try to defeat all the other player's Tanks or reach his HQ. The battle can turn quickly with the use of the supply cards that can grant you an Air Strike, a Team of Engineers to repair broken Tanks or even a very useful Hijacker.

Name: Saucer Scramble
Description: From the box, "Chase 'em as they spin... catch 'em fast to win! Alien antics fly high in this outer-space, spin-out-of-control game! As the flying saucers launch from the spaceship, they soar into the air and whirl in gravity-defying acrobatics. Your mission is to catch them in your nets before they land. So get ready to run around and act spacey!"

Name: Diceland: Horus Promo Die
Description: This was a promotional die given away for the 2002 Origins Game Fair in Columbus, OH.  It is a pretty standard Diceland die, with a jump special ability, and a weak, weak attack. Horus is a fighter for the Gypsy Queen army.

Name: Terror on the Bozeman Trail: Red Cloud's War
Description:
The Bozeman Trail is an epic from Red Cloud's War (1866-1868). As head of American forces, will you assure the security of the colonists, construct a fort, and escort working parties while defending yourself from Indian attack?  Will the impetuous Captain W.J. Fetterman break-through the blockade that is strangling your forces more and more each day?  Or perhaps you will take on the role of Red Cloud and his warriors: American Horse, Big Road, Brave Eagle, and Crazy Horse!  You will harass the Boys in Blue and drive them from the land, while being wary of the power of their weapons.  Ambush will be your best weapon, and you may be able to end it all with an assault on the fort itself.

Includes:
17" x 22" map
280 die-cut counters
1 Turn = 3 Months, 1 counter = 1 leader, or 15-20 US soldiers/cavalrymen, or civilians, or 100 Sioux warriors
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Television Trivia Game
Description:
From the back of the box:

Small enough to go anywhere, Television trivia travels well, whether on a trip, in the car for long drives, or over to a friend's house for hours of trivia fun. There are no complex rules or pieces to keep track of - just open and enjoy!

Categories test your knowledge of five great TV decades from the 1950's to the 1990's.

There is no board or any such pieces,  There are 5 questions per card (a question about a show from the 50's, 60's, 70's, 80's, and 90's)
You decide how many points you want to play to before starting the game. A correct answer is worth 1 point.

Name: Jim Prentice Electric Baseball Model 48-B
Description:
This game is very similar to Jim Prentice Electric Baseball Model 505, however the pitcher physically rolls a steel ball to down a pathway on the board and the batter has to push a button that will trap the ball between the 'bat' and a contact. With a successful 'hit' various lights will light up either singly or in combination, indicating the outcome of the play. If the batter misses the ball, the pitch can be a strike if it stops in front of a small rise in the pitching track. If the ball goes past the rise, then it is considered a ball.

This introduces some dexterity into the gameplay rather than the outcome being determined by electronics

Name: Mimik Memo
Description:
From publisher site:

Little hippo chuckles and pokes out his tongue while trying to touch the tip of his nose. The children first turn round an animal card and imitate the snout shown there. Then they try to find the identical animal card. With each error, however, the cheeky monkey Anthony moves one square ahead. Will the children be quicker than Anthony? A co-operative memory game for 2-6 little face acrobats ages 3-8. Includes competition variation.

Name: Tempt
Description:
Tempt is the 8th game in Small Box Games Pure Card Line.

In Tempt, players are powerful warlords vying for control of a splintering empire.  Players tempt powerful Cohorts to fight for their cause.  The fleeting Temptresses grant the players additional special abilities.  Tempt is a mix of strategy, tactics, and clever card play.  The player controlling the largest portion of the kingdom after the conflict ends, wins the game.

Tempt takes place over several rounds of play.  Each round, each player will receive 3 turns.  A round always begins with players secretly selecting 2 Temptress cards to aid them for the round.  The 3 facedown Cohort decks in the middle of the play area represent 3 areas of the kingdom, and each player controls a Column on his side of each area where he can Tempt powerful Cohorts, in attempts to gain and hold control of that area.  The player with the strongest Column has Primacy in that area and is awarded extra points and actions.  Cohorts may also be tempted as Chanters, granting the player additional abilities.

Due to the artwork on some of the cards, Tempt is not recommended for gamers under the age of 13.
Families: Series: Pure Card Line (Small Box Games)

Name: Soundtracks
Description:
Contents:
CD
4 game boards
40 counters
Guide

From the box: 
"The award winning listening game!

Children will love listening to the real sounds and matching them to the photographs on their game boards.  Start the CD anywhere for a different game each time."

Play the sounds on the included CD.  Each player tries to identify the sound and the first person to do so places a counter in the corresponding place on their player board. Players race to complete their board. The sounds on the CD are of a wide variety (e.g. transport, animals etc).

Name: Feuerwehr
Description:
Fire Brigade from Haba - Fifo, the fire dragon, is playing with matches. Suddenly, flames are everywhere and the alarm bells are ringing. Who will help the brave firemen fight the blaze? Three suggestions for playing, assigning, puzzling and observing closely. For one child and an adult.

Game & Puzzle: with game and puzzle HABA combines three classic product groups into a new innovative series. The articles each contain three thematically conceived child-adopted game ideas of increasing degree of difficulty. - classifying game aged 2+ - simple dice game aged 3+ - jigsaw puzzle and searching game aged 4+ As children grow they keep on learning and the game ideas of Game & Puzzle therefore continues to be a stimulating toy over a long time.

Name: Mini Cootie
Description:
From the instruction booklet:

Object
Be the first player to complete a Cootie character.

Contents
-Instruction booklet
-1 large 6-sided die
-6 cardboard Cootie heads
-6 cardboard Cootie bodies
-6 cardboard Cootie tails

Setup
Put all of the Cootie parts in a pile in the center of the playing surface.

Gameplay
1. Youngest player goes first.  Roll the die.

If you roll a Cootie part, take that part from the pile and place it in front of you.  If you already have that part, do nothing and pass the die to the next player.
  
If you roll a picture with 3 Cootie parts you can choose any one of those parts.
If you roll a red "X" you must put one of your parts back in the pile.

If you roll a picture of the die you can take another turn.

2. Pass the die to the next player to the left and follow the same game play.

Note:  You can mix different color Cootie parts or keep all the parts the same color.

Winning
The first player to complete his Cootie wins the game.  For a longer game, play 3 rounds.  The player who wins the most rounds wins that game.

Restorage
Save your package because after you play the game you can put all the parts back in the bag and reseal it.

Name: Mini Don't Break the Ice
Description:
From the instruction booklet:

Object
The player to collect the most fish before the ice is broken wins the game.

Contents
-4 tiles with 2 fish on them
-12 tiles with 1 fish on them
-1 penguin tile
-1 broken ice tile
-1 Skating Bear pawn with stand
-Instruction booklet

Setup
1. Remove one 1-fish tile and one 2-fish tile from the game.  Shuffle the remaining 16 tiles and arrange them picture side down in a 4x4 grid.
2. Place the Skating Bear next to the tile grid.

Gameplay
1. Youngest player goes first.  Place the Skating Bear on any tile.
2. Lift up the bear and turn over the tile.  If you see a picture of one or two fish on the tile place it in front of you.
3. Place the Skating Bear in the empty space for the next player to move.
4. Play continues to the left following the same game play.

Turning over the Penguin tile
If you turn over the penguin you must give up one of your fish tiles.  Take the tile and put it aside out of play.  Your turn is over.

Turning over the Broken Ice tile
If at any time during the game a player turns over the broken ice tile, the game is over.  Each player now counts all the fish pictured on their tiles.

Winning
The player with the most fish wins the game.  If there is a tie for the most fish then all tied players are winners!

Optional Gameplay
For a quicker game, try a 3x3 tile grid but remember to keep the penguin and broken ice tile in the grid.

Restorage
Save your package because after you play the game you can put all the parts back in the bag and reseal it.

Name: Manufactura
Description:
Manufactura is the game that stimulates the productive processes of a factory and the commercialization of its products to the market. It demonstrates the importance of the Lean production, in other words, it shows the concept of producing in a Lean way. This concept was originated with the Toyota Production System and aims at increasing the speed of the processes, eliminating waste and reducing costs.

In the game, the players are presidents of companies which need to produce their products and sell them to the clients. These clients, however, only buy from companies that offer the lower prices. To offer competitive prices, they will have to improve their factories, which present limited production capacity and serious quality problems. The secret is to produce faster, better and with a lower cost. The person who achieves the greater total income is the winner.

Manufactura may be played by all employees who are part of the productive area of a company, or by those who are just curious about its operational system. With this game, they will all learn and know the Lean culture and its advantages and benefits.

Name: Inside ISO 9001
Description:
Inside ISO 9001 is the game about the ISO 9001, which provides guidelines on how to administrate and assure the quality of products and processes. This approach allows the company in question to improve its quality and to increase its productivity and its clients’ satisfaction.

While playing, the participants compete against each other on a fictional race to see who is the first to achieve the certification. The players are challenged to answer correctly to ISO 9001 related questions. The person who first reaches the certification, in other words, the end of the path, is the winner.

Inside ISO 9001 is recommended to companies and professionals who are interested on the quality system, or who are facing a certification process. The game is a tool to people who are learning about the ISO 9001 and to those are already acquainted with the process but would like to improve their knowledge. The game can also be used as advertisement and celebration tool for those companies that just conquered the certification.

Name: White Belts Combat
Description:
White Belts Combat is the board game in which the White Belts duel in a battle of martial arts and of knowledge over the Six Sigma fundaments. The dispute stage is an oriental temple and the winner is the one who combines the best punches with the most precise answers.

The game was developed for combat between two fighters. They get on to a mat and the aim is to throw one’s opponent off it. To do so, one must answer the questions correctly and strike the strongest punch.

White Belts Combat is ideally distributed to company White Belts. With this game, these professionals may deepen, perfect or recycle their knowledge on Six Sigma. Besides, this product aims to promote or revitalize the Six Sigma programs within the organization.

Name: Belts Challenge
Description:
Belts Challenge is a game of strategy and knowledge. In order to win, the players must combine their strategic skills with a good measure of Six Sigma knowledge.

In this game, each player starts by receiving a card with aims and resources to be applied. The aims are linked to the improvement of the company processes. During the game, the players answer the questions correctly, the resources bet in each round are incorporated into the process and the improvement is therefore made. The players thus get more resources to be applied. If, on the other hand, they answer the questions incorrectly, the resources are wasted, which means that they do not remain in the processes and the players are not entitled to new resources. The winner is the one who first completes the three proposed objectives..

This game’s players are Green Belts and Black Belts and they will have an excellent opportunity to challenge their knowledge and company management resource skills while going after a stipulated objective.

Name: Inside 14001
Description:
Inside ISO 14001 is the game in which players will have the opportunity to know more about the requirements and characteristics of this norm and will go through the experience of a fictitious certification process through a race. The winner will be the first to reach the final ISO 14001 certification process.

Through this game, players learn what requirements are and get to know some of them, what conformable and non conformable situations are, and players also become aware that it is the people and their attitudes that result in the success of ISO 1400.

This game is interesting for companies that are already ISO 14001 and for those going through the process of becoming ISO 14001.Inside ISO 14001 helps employee awareness and adaptation to the contents and details of this norm.

Name: Climate Game
Description:
Climate Game is a game which when played with strategy, negotiation and diplomacy, challenges its players to save the world from imminent destruction. With everyone’s effort and awareness, the emission of carbonic gas can be reduced before it is too late.

This game is both one of competition and of cooperation. It promotes competition because the player who emits no carbonic gas at all is the winner. But, integrated work of all the other participants is essential in order not to exceed the gas limits of the greenhouse effect that the planet can put up with. If this limit is exceeded, the Earth’s temperature will have risen to a level where human life is not possible and everyone dies/loses.

Therefore, participants must have a good degree of knowledge regarding gas emission and the greenhouse effect and also be very good at negotiating and formulating strategies.

Name: Eco Planet
Description:
Eco Planet is a board game aimed at environment preservation awareness. The players have a race to see who gets to Eco Planet first, which is an ecologically tolerable place. In order to get there, the players must know the causes, effects, consequences and solutions for the planet’s degradation.

There are five theme groups: air, water, soil, global warming and environmental awareness. When a player gets the correct answers to the questions asked about the theme he/she is on, he/she moves forward on the board.

Eco Planet may be distributed to employees, clients, suppliers, partners and to the community for the promotion of the planet preservation idea. This game can and must be taken home and played with the whole family and with friends.

http://www.games4b.com/ecoplanet.php

Name: Zhi Ji Zhi Bi
Description:
It is a card game.
The aim of this game is to identify and eliminate your ennemies.

At the beginning, the four players receive one card. It will determine which team you are part of (Blue Ying Yang or Red Ying Yang). Players should keep theirs secret.

At your turn, you had to play a card :

- hit someone (10 pts, 20 pts, 30 pts)
- heal someone
- protect someone
- identify someone

You can't heal or protect yourself.
When someone has been hit for an amount of more than 101 pts, he must reveal his identity and he is dead.

Name: O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA
Description:
O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é o jogo que fala sobre a CIPA Comissão Interna de Prevenção de Acidentes. Essa norma tem como objetivo a prevenção de acidentes e doenças decorrentes do trabalho, de modo a tornar compatível permanentemente o trabalho com a preservação da vida e a promoção da saúde do trabalhador.

No jogo os participantes concorrem para ver quem será o primeiro a atravessar a trilha da CIPA. Para avançar no tabuleiro é necessário acertar as perguntas que falam dos vários temas: principais normas regulamentadoras, equipamentos de proteção, mapa de risco, classe de fogo, universo CIPA e áreas da fábrica. Durante o jogo, os papeis desempenhados pelos participantes, que são os mesmos na CIPA de verdade, vão se alternando, o que aumenta a emoção do jogo.

O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é um jogo que deve ser distribuído para os cipeiros e para os funcionários das empresas como forma de conscientização para os perigos e os riscos do ambiente de trabalho, assim como para a educação do uso dos equipamentos de segurança individual ou coletiva. É um jogo que pode ser distribuído como brinde nas SIPATs (Semana Interna de Prevenção de Acidentes do Trabalho), em eleições da CIPA, ou mesmo em aniversários e comemorações relacionadas às metas de segurança da empresa.

Assim, o Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é o jogo ideal para a promoção da cultura da segurança do trabalho. Lembre-se que acidentes podem ser prevenidos pelo seu conhecimento e atitude! A segurança de todos depende de você e do treinamento da sua equipe. Bom jogo.


O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is the game that talks about the CIPA Committee for the Prevention of Accidents. This standard aims at preventing accidents and illnesses resulting from work in order to make it compatible to work permanently with the preservation of life and the promotion of occupational health.

In the game the participants compete to see who will be the first to cross the path of CIPA. To advance on the board, you must set the questions that speak of various subjects: major regulatory standards, protective equipment, risk map, class of fire, the universe and CIPA areas of the factory. During the game, the roles played by participants, which are the same in real CIPA, will be switching, which increases the excitement of the game.

O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is a game that should be distributed to the accident prevention commission and employees of companies such as awareness of the dangers and risks of the workplace, as well as for the education of use of safety equipment individually or collectively. It is a game that can be distributed as a gift in SIPATs (Week for the Prevention of Accidents at Work), in elections of CIPA, or even birthdays and celebrations related to the security goals of the company.

Thus, knowing O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is the ideal game for the promotion of culture of safety. Remember that accidents can be prevented by their knowledge and attitude! The safety of all depends on you and training your team. Good game.

Name: Ritual
Description:
Introduction:

Ri+Val (Ritual) is a game of strategy based on the Books of Rituals. 
The books are collections of rituals, where each page is an ancient manuscript with which you can tackle your opponent. 
In Ritual every player embodies the spirit of an Immortal Sorcerer who must demonstrate his magical abilities and strategic skills. 
Each book is protected by 5 seals: once they are destroyed the Sorcerer can take possession of the opponent's Book: 
the ultimate goal is to control as many books as possible becoming the most powerful sorcerer in History!

Setting:
Millenias ago, an ancient powerfull civilazation was at its most high evolution point. All of its society was based on the magic and spiritual power of Nature. There were five Guilds,
Earth, Fire, Water, Air and the Guil of Destiny which rulled them all with justice and equity.
One day Evok, the demon spirit of the Abyss, escaped from his century long imprisonment. He promised revenge over the ones who chained him for so long in Darkness.
Gathering all sorts of evil souls and demons he attacked with fury the Capital of that ancient world.
The flames reached the sky, floods destroyed the land and everything seeemed near to an end...
The most powerfull Sorcerers then united their powers for the final battle against Evok: after an epical fight the evil spirit was resealed in his Jail forever.
Unfortunatly, that ancient world was destined to extinction, therefore the Sorcers wrote down on books all their knowledge and magic power.
Now these books have returned to chose the future of this world: who will be the most powerfull Sorcerer?!

General Game Rules:
Every player has a book which contains 33 Rituals
Evey book is "protected" by 5 Seals (this can be read as every player has 5 life points)
The Rituals are devided in Curses, Blessings and Summonings
which use Runes to be cast in to play.
They also have Element Points and Seal points which show the
power of every single Ritual.

Every turn you have 5 Runes to use.
The Turn is divided into 
1-Casting Phase: 
put into play the Rituals

2-Combat Phase
fighting phase

3-Closing Phase
resolution of combat

This is the general description of the game's rules,
shortly it will be available on the website.

Name: Basic Action Super Heroes! Sci-Fi Edition
Description:
This is a Sci-Fi themed variant of the original Basic Action Super Heroes! game.

The basic mechanic is rolling 2d6 and multiplying the result by the appropriate stat (Brawn, Agility, or Mind) plus any applicable modifiers and beating a target number. Simple and easy.

Characters are built on points. While there are plenty of options here, it won't take you hours to build a character and you could jot all relevant stats down on a 3x5 index card.

This version includes guides for creating alien races. There are also rules for starship combat. Scenarios range from Victorian Steampunky Sci-Fi to Sci-Fi Fantasy to Post Apocolyptic genre.

Name: Five Star Final
Description:
This newspaper-themed board game was based on 1931 movie "Five Star Final". The game includes a large (30" x 17") and heavy board, five player tokens, 40 Service Tokens, a deck of yellow Assignment Cards, and a deck of white News Cards.

Players take Assignment Cards from the Editor that show events underway around the board. They then choose how to travel there: by foot, bus, elevated, taxi or subway. By foot is slowest but reaches everywhere; subway is fastest but can mean an additional walk to many locations.

To complete an assignment, reporters first must arrive on the spot by exact roll of either two dice or one of the two. If they fail to land on the space two turns in a row, they have missed the story and must head back to the office. However, if they stroll back, they get a chance to draw an Assignment card on any other Assignment location on which they land, getting partial or full credit for that story instead.

Players who do land on their Assignment locations must then try to draw a News Card that matches their assignments, drawing twice a turn until they do. When they do draw the right match, they normally get one Service Token, but none if sent to Rewrite, and two if labelled Front Page. Then they head back to get another assignment. First player to get five Service Tokens wins.

Name: Felix Farbenschaf
Description:
From the back of the box:

Conrad, the notorious colour sheep, is back in action! He eagerly dips his brush alternately into the red, the yellow, the blue, and the green paint pot: Conrad paints everything he has seen on his last trip – and that is quite a lot! Each of you gets three picture cards. Try and move Conrad to the paint pot cards and discard your card of the same colour. Be the first to discard all your cards and win the game!

Name: Rechen-Piraten: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
The wild number-pirates once again set off on treasure hunt: Capt. Mathematikus and his parrot Lora sail the Seven Seas. “Treasure island on starboard!“, Lora suddenly caws. Which number treasure will they find today? All players calculate at the same time. Each card displays four arithmetic problems. But only one goes with the operators on the dices. The first player to provide the correct solution receives the card as their reward. Winner is the first to collect five cards.

A pirate-worthy card game for 2 – 4 number pirates

Name: Verhext nochmal!
Description:
The powerful witch Gundula charmed seven princes. To releases them from the spell, players have to prove their own magical powers and brew a miraculous potion. The princes will be released as soon as the great potion is finished. To mix the elixir and collect prince cards you have to add always two ingredients in the exact order. In the end, you piece your prince cards together and count the points your prince scores. The larger the prince, the more points he scores!

A bewitched card game for 2 – 4 bright junior witches

Name: Dragon War: Gateways Set
Description:
This set adds 6 gateway cards.

The cards are randomly added to the field to provide 'gateways' forward and backwards.

The cards allow players the ability to 'gate' through the line of cards, unfortunately the 'jump' is made to a random gate.

This expansion can now be obtained as a free download on their site.

Name: Sword of Fire: the Battle of Lutter, 27th August 1626
Description:
After having passed most of the summer season waiting for event, Christian of Denmark decided to stir himself up and join the other part of his army to combat Tilly, left a little unmanned after having lost several detachments to guard conquered cities. His movements where to slow, and when the two armies joined battle, Tilly was probably a little superior to his opponent. Christian was unable to avoid the clash, and he suffered a defeat.

Each combat unit represents from 250 to 1500 soldiers, and it is rated, from left to right, for combat morale and movement. Each infantry strength point is around 150 men, each cavalry strength point around 80 men. Each leader is rated for Command (indicating how many activation chits that leader has) and Movement.

Each hex is about 75 meters.
Each turn is half on hour.

Contains:
6 page rules
11x17" map (in 2 8.5x11" parts)
1 player aid
216 counters and markers

Name: Battle for Korsun
Description:
(from Ad on CSW:)

This is an operational level game, for two players, of the battles that took place in January and February 1944 near the small Russian town of Korsun.

Units are battalions and regiments for the Germans and regiments/brigades and divisions for the Soviets. 
Map scale is 3.2 Kms/hex and each turns represents two days.

Battle for Korsun comes with a full colour 32" x 20" map in 4 sections, 297 mounted color counters, rule book and charts in a ziplock bag.

Name: Dice Floor
Description:
A game for 2 or 3 players, played with 36 dice per player. Each player tries to score higher than their opponents in rows and columns of a 6x6 grid they fill in with dice.

Each player will fill in his grid die after die, but all players will be using the same die value on a given turn.

In the end, the player with the most high scoring lines wins the game.

Name: Star Fleet Scramble
Description:
This is it, pilot. The ultimate battle.

Your fleet is flying toward the enemy, breaking formation to engage individual ships. Each ship charges toward an enemy sector, raising shields to prevent attacks. You have three classes of ships, and your goal is to destroy enough fighting capacity of the enemy fleet to defeat it.

A Star Fleet Scramble set includes:

- A Star Fleet Scramble flexible A4 board.

- 9 blue acrylic ships: 3 battlecruisers (largest), 3 destroyers (midsized), and 3 corvettes (smallest).

- 9 red acrylic ships: 3 battlecruisers (largest), 3 destroyers (midsized), and 3 corvettes (smallest).

This is the 3rd nestorized Icehouse game.

Name: Battlefield Evolution: Pacific War – World War Two Miniatures Rules 1944-1945
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Japan’s imperialistic ambitions to dominate the entire Pacific may seem a mad gamble when viewed from a comfortable 21st Century perspective, but it should be remembered that, in the 1940’s, empires still existed. European powers had commanded vast tracts of the Pacific region for centuries, and the British Empire remained the largest in history. On the other side of the world, Germany had dominated almost the whole of continental Europe, so the idea of powerful nations taking territory by force was an attractive idea that, today, might seem repugnant.

Despite naval actions in oceans over the globe, it was Japan’s entry into the war that truly turned hostilities into a World War. By attacking Pearl Harbour, Japan ensured the United States was put into a position whereby it could no longer remain neutral. No longer was the fighting confined to Europe and Africa, with warships trading blows overseas. Now the people of almost every continent were directly affected by war.

Ultimately, Japan failed in its gamble. Before it fell, however, it had dealt the United States a grievous blow, and all but ended the hold European countries had in the region (not least because they had their own problems back in Europe). Once forced on the defensive, Japan proved to be a terrible enemy, its people willing to fight to their last breath, ferociously resisting the advance of the Allies as its forces were gradually pushed back to the Japanese islands.

The end of the Pacific war marked the end of the Second World War as a whole, an ending that was mushroom-shaped and terrifying., leading on to a new struggle that would hold the world in its grip for the rest of the 20th Century.

This supplement for Battlefield Evolution: World at War contains army lists and new rules for the following armies, in all periods of the Pacific War.

British Army and Commonwealth
Chindits
Imperial Japanese Army
Imperial Japanese SNLF
United States Marines Corps

Name: Finnish Civil War
Description:
Finnish Civil War, is a simulation game of the civil conflict in Finland in the early months of 1918.  The game is for two players, one representing the recently elected government of the recently independent state (the White player) and the other the perhaps-irresistible forces of proletarian revolution (the Red Player).

The game comes in two versions: 
1) a company/battalion scale one which uses a system heavily modified from the designer's previously published games Freikorps, Konarmiya and War Plan Crimson; and 
2) a brigade scale one that uses fewer counters and an even more heavily modified system.

Both versions use the same map (hex grid of southern Finland, at 12 map miles/ 20 km per hex). Special units and chromy bits include: variable-strength Red and White Guard units; Armored Trains; the spring thaw that occurred midway through the war; peace negotiations, German intervention and Russian withdrawal (including the Future Guilt Clause!); General Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim; guerrillas; purges; and the Swedish Talent Agency.

Was available for free download at designer's personal webpage from end of 2009, but in October 2012 the designer concluded an agreement with Compass Games for them to publish this game in Paper Wars magazine. Compass Games has requested that the free version of the game be taken down. Both versions of the game appeared in issue #84 of the magazine, in December 2016.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 7 days
Hex: 12 miles / 20 kilometers
Units: Company to Brigade

Game Inventory:
One 17 x 22" full-color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (240 1/2" counters)
One 20-page Finnish Civil War rulebook

Solitaire Suitability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-6 hours

Note: One 6-sided die is needed for play

Name: Behind the Lens
Description:
Behind the Lens features 12 endangered species native to New Zealand and their habitats.

Join a team of wild life photographers who are taking a collection of photos overseas to an exhibition. Just as they are about to leave, they discover that three of their photos are spoiled. By helping each other and using your memory, work out which photos are Behind the Lens, but hurry - the plane leaves when it's full.

Name: Squiggle Connect
Description:
Squiggle Connect is a hilarious drawing game where players compete by changing a squiggly line into a picture. No artistic talent required . . . just your imagination!

It all starts with a roll of the dot cube and then the dots are connected by random lines using the connect cube. Once everyone has their unique squiggly line in front of them, play begins. Players have 60 seconds to transform their wavy and wacky line into a picture. They can be as simple or detailed as they want. When time is up, each player explains their drawing to the other players. This is where you may fall over laughing as you listen to some real nonsense! Once each player has had chance to explain what they drew, voting begins. Each player votes on only one other players drawing using a voting card.

The voting cards offer either a descriptive praise or a nuance of criticism such as "put that in a doggie bag" or "a monkey can do better". Each card also has a point value and players give them to each other based on their picture and description. It’s hysterical!

SQUIGGLE Connect recently won a National Parenting Publications Gold Award!

(from manufacturer's website)

Name: Gibs
Description:
Life has always been hard for the gibs.  This sub terrain race always had a soft spot for shiny objects.  Now that some gems have shown themselves the gibs have all flocked after them.

This light fast paced strategy game can be played in just a half hour and supports 2-4 players.  Be the player that has collected the most gems of a single color.

There is a full page of Variants in the new edition to change up game play.

First edition scoring can still be used but 2nd edition has a new Scoring system to stop people from being able to swing the game to dramatically in a single turn.

Name: Doubloon Dippity
Description:
Doubloon Dippidy is the game that comes with the "collectible" octopus, Dip.  The game is similar to LCR.  Players start with 2 coins.  Players take turns rolling a pair of dice.  Depending one what is rolled, the player may have to give coins to the bank or the player on the left or collect to coins.  Play continues until only one player has coins left.

The game brings an Octopus, special dice, 30 plastic doubloons & a drawstring bag.

Name: Sink or Swim
Description: Sink or Swin is a die game that comes with the collectible Octopi Grippa.  In the game players roll dice until either they come up with a clownfish or seahorse, which takes the die out of for the turn, or another face which is worth 1 to 3 points.  Players keep rolling until they are happy with results or out of dice to roll.

Name: Bed of Pearls
Description:
Bed of Pearls is the game that comes with the collectible Octopi named Pearl.  The game is vaguely similar to Yahtzee.  Players roll dice trying to get good combination.  A player can keep rolling until he is happy with the roll or rolls out.

However when you finish your roll and pass the dice.  The next player can decide to roll all dice allowing you to score or try and build on your roll.

Name: Rolaweel Three in One
Description:
User summary...

Advertised as "Everyone's Game".  Basically three different version of spin a spinner and lay down a bland chip on a bland board.  In 1926 this was considered Entertaining, Fascinating and Thrilling!

Says so right on the box.

Name: Giggles Game of Action
Description:
User Summary...

Spin a top and wait to see which giggling child's mouth the balls land in to score points. Laugh with your friends and laugh at yourself - Giggles Game of Action!

Name: Monkey Shines
Description:
User Summary...

A children's acting game.  Pull a cardboard monkey out of the box, read the action silently to yourself and act out as directed.  Either award points for the best acting or use the cards to play charades.

Name: Pizza Party
Description:
(publisher blurb):
A mouth-watering way to learn fractions! This set of 12 realistic 12" (30. 5cm) pizzas is the "main course" upon which eight different fraction games are based. Includes 12 cardboard pizzas cut into halves, thirds, fourths, sixths, eighths, ninths, twelfths, and sixteenths, plus two spinners and an activity sheet. Comes in a sturdy pizza parlor box! For two to six players.

(from box front):
Pizza Party Includes:
- 2 spinners
- Activity Sheet with 8 Games
- 59 Full-Color Fraction Pizza Pieces

Players Will:
- Identify halves, thirds, fourths, sixths, eights, ninths, twelfths, and sixteenths
- Identify fractional parts of the whole
- Match fractional notation to concrete models
- Identify equivalent fractions and fractional parts
- Subtract fractional parts from a whole and other fractions

For 2-6 players
Grades 1-6

(description of the 8 games from the activity sheet):
1. Pizza Cover-Up
Skill/Purpose: Identifying the fractional parts that make up a whole.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to cover a pizza with pizza pieces.

2. Pizza Play-Off
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying the fractional parts that make up a whole.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to complete your pizza, with no overlapping pieces.

3. Pizza Pickup
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most pieces after eight turns.

4. Penny a Pair
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most points after three rounds of play.

5. Fraction Line-Up
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have one pizza piece of each size: 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/6, 1/8, 1/9, 1/12, and 1/16.

6. Pizza Patch
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying fractions that are even parts or multiples of another fraction.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have two pizzas in a winnings pile.

7. Undercover
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most points after 20 rounds of play.

8. Empty the Pan
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts; subtracting fractional parts from a whole/other fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have no part of a pizza left.

Name: O' PenzedoR!
Description:
O'penzedor is the first game of young designer Cedric Joint.
The game is about opening doors and facing the magic spells behind it. If you have the right counter-spell among the cards in your hands you succeed and win arcane points; if you lose, you can continue though lose points and you give advantages to your opponents (new counter-spell cards).
Some cards with special power spice up the regular magic spells.
O'penzedor is a very simple and fun card-game with nice artwork from Pierro (Ghost Stories, En Garde, Linq, Mr. Jack).
[user summary of playtesting]

Name: Armoured Wargaming: A Detailed Guide to Model Tank Warfare
Description:
User Summary:

Primarily an historical digest of armor unit statistics, the book also contains a dozen pages of rules for 1:300 scale model tank wargaming.  Scenarios and mixed- unit rules are, however, left to the reader's imagination.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Super Sadistic Advanced Empire Builder
Description:
Empire Builder is a classic crayon-rail game by Mayfair, with many followups now available. The core idea of Empire Builder is that players to draw their train routes over a map of the United States. Players start with enough money to build short lengths of track, and by running their trains and delivering loads to various cities acquire more cash to expand their networks.

Super Sadistic Advanced Empire Builder (SSAEB) is an improved and much more challenging version of the base game. Numerous changes have been made: the payoffs on the contract cards have been lowered, the event cards are changed to be much more challenging, two new train types are added, and upgrade costs are increased.

By modifying the basic Empire Builder game with this expansion set, players will have a more challenging and longer game, but one that is more satisfying for hard-core gamers. SSAEB is for die-hard Empire Builder fans only!

Name: ASL Annual '92
Description:
While decidedly a primarily ASL forum at this point, this issue did include a purely Squad Leader campaign game, which included a bunch of 'mini' scenarios to play through.

From the Table of Contents:
Soldiers of the Sun by Charles Markuss
Series Replay: A41 Op Hill by Chuck Goetz, Perry Cocke and Pat Jonke
Pigi-Pigi by Steven Swann
The Commando Campaign Game by Rex A Martin
The Doomed Battalions by Charles Markuss
And Here We Damned Well Played by Mark Nixon
Guilt By Accusation? by John Farris, Jay Kaufman and George Windau

Scenarios:
A39 Showdown at Tug Argan Pass
A40 Ad Hoc at Beaurains
A41 OP Hill
A42 Commando Hunt
A43 Probing Layforce
A44 Blocking Action at Lipki
A45 Chakila Sunrise
A46 Rattle of Sabres
A47 White Tigers
A48 Best-Laid Plans
A49 Delaying Action
A50 ...And Here We Damned Well Stay
DA9 Royal Marines
DA10 The Tiger of Toungoo
HA2 The Commissar's House

Name: Assault of the Dead
Description:
Rulebook:
You and your companions are a ragtag bunch of zombie-fighting survivors waging a battle against a horde of the dead engulfing the city. Your team will travel across the hotspots, stemming the tide of hungry dead and helping the remaining survivors to safe houses. You must work together, using whatever skills are available to save the survivors before the dead rise up and destroy the city. The clock is ticking as every moment in the hotspot their hunger grows. Will you be able to succeed before the attack of the dead?

Name: The Green and The Tan
Description:
Miniatures rules for plastic Army Men wargaming.  Simple, d6-based rule set that simulates WW2 to modern era combat.

From the publisher:
Plays in 30 minutes or less 
Useable with any cheap figures or carboard "stand-ups" 
No army lists, counters or book keeping required 
Weapons include flame throwers, machine guns, mortars and bazooka 
Rules for infantry, tanks, helicopters, minefields, and mission objectives 
Unit activation based on squad strength / casualties

Name: UNO: Kung Fu Panda
Description: Join Po & the Martial Arts Masters for an UNO card game showdown! Challenge any opponent to a Kickin' Battle with the exclusive card & rule! And Don't forget to yell UNO when you are about to become the Chosen One!
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Nessi!
Description: The swimming ring is placed into the water, players receive all discs of one colour. In his turn a player drops one of his discs into the water, it schwims either showing Nessi or the empty side. Then the next player drops a disc, if it hits another disc in the water, this is turned over. When all discs have been dropped, the player with the most Nessis visisble on his discs wins the game. In a variant one can end the game when the first player has 5 Nessis showing.

Name: Pantomime
Description: Ssssh! With hands and feet only, the players in Pantomime describe the pictures on the cards to other players. Whoever speaks or makes a noise loses.

Name: Lesehexe
Description:
In Lesehexe, you want to find as many matching word cards as possible. Start by placing a green starter card (A-M) into the card frame, then search for a matching word card. To check whether the cards have been placed together correctly, try to place the witch's shoes into the cutouts. Who can collect the most word cards?

Lesehexe includes seven different game ideas for practicing letters and simple words, providing players with plenty of variety.

Name: Großer Preis von Deutschland
Description:
User Summary:
An old roll and move race game in german language about Nurburgring circuit.
The players throw the dice to determine the starting positions, then advance their tokens according to the subsequent launch of the dice.
On the track there are points that help competitors to move faster, or force them to lose precious time waiting for a favorable launch.
The first player who crosses the finish line after six turns (but at beginning of the game he may also determine a different number) is the winner.

Name: Indiana Jones, Il Gioco
Description:
User summary:
The players in the shoes of Indiana Jones trying to collect treasures found in various parts of the world, moving through cards and dice.
The game map divides the world into 5 zones. The players depart from North America, their base, and move on other continents where they are hidden treasures to find.
On every continent there are 3 decks of cards and the last of each deck is a treasure that can be real or false in 2 cases out of three.
The goal of the game is, therefore, to discard the cards placed over the treasure to get to the bottom of the pile and earn the trophy.
The cards are discarded throwing the dice and passing score on the card in various skills, if it not succeeds, the card remains in place.
The more cards you discard the more your skills will increase.
When discovered 4 treasures will be turned into points and the player with most points is the winner.

Name: The Flintstones
Description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game with cartoon characters...
From back box:
"Everything is ready for departure. Competitors shudder at the wheel of race cars craziest of prehistory.
Here deploy robust Flintmobile , the fast Sabertooth, the reliable Rubblemobile and, finally, the agile Rockasaki.
And now are start!
Along the streets of Bedrock City held the most exhilarating race of prehistory. Vehicles from different performance and unplanned stop decided by your passengers, refueling or police checks, will make the race even more enjoyable. But remember that luck is not enough. A bit of strategy may prove decisive.
Is best a fast vehicle that consumes many gasoline  or that slow one but never stop? The choice is yours. So are you ready? The craziest race of prehistory is about to begin. Yabba-dabba-doo!

Name: I Numeri Incrociati
Description:
User summary:
Addition with numbers like Scrabble.
From box:
"I Numeri Incrociati" are for lovers of figures and calculations that are the crossword puzzles for fans of the vocabulary.
The principle is simple: to achieve, adding the chips numbered one or more of the numbers from the cards drawn at random at the beginning of the game.
At the billboard can cross because each successive combinations can be achieved either horizontally or vertically.

Name: Campionato Mondiale Formula Uno
Description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game of the early '70.
From rules:
Contestants will choose their cars and take the card boxes and card run.
Will proceed in turn by moving their marker on the track, every move you will throw 2 dice and the number obtained will happen what happens on their card race (eg wildfire: stop for 2 shifts, skidding: advance 2 spaces ...).
If the dice roll indicates the stop in the pits the player must stop at the next garage space on the track and throw a dice to see the consequences (eg, oil change: stop a turn; tire change: advance 2 spaces, etc..)
Win the race who will cut the finish line first.
It's possible can make an entire season of 15 Grand Prix.
